Package net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math

Class PiecewiseConstantWeekday

java.lang.Object
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math.AbstractPiecewiseConstant
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math.PiecewiseConstantWeekday
All Implemented Interfaces:
PiecewiseConstant
public final class PiecewiseConstantWeekday extends AbstractPiecewiseConstant
Immutable implementation of PiecewiseConstant that models a weekly workload pattern.

Each of the 7 DayOfWeek values is associated with a constant Fraction representing the workload for that day (for example 3/10 for 30%). A zero value is meaningful and represents no allocation on that day.

This implementation intentionally avoids storing a precomputed list of time segments. Instead, it generates one-day Segment instances lazily as the caller iterates forward in time. This design scales well for rules that conceptually apply across the whole LocalDateTime timeline.

Segments produced by #iterateSegmentsFrom(LocalDateTime) are daily intervals of the form [dayStart, nextDayStart).

    • with

      public PiecewiseConstantWeekday with(DayOfWeek day, Fraction newWorkload)
      Returns a new instance with the workload of one day replaced.

      This method supports a persistent/functional style of updates: the current instance is never modified.

      Parameters:
      day - day of week to update
      newWorkload - new workload fraction for that day
      Returns:
      a new immutable instance
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
